reviews.title: Convenient and economical place to stay if looking for something close to airport
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 13 de mayo de 2024
reviews.negative_feedback: Unfortunately the pool had recently been treated, so we were not able to get in a quick dip since we arrived late from the airport and had to leave early.
reviews.positive_feedback: The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating!  Any problems or needs we had were met and exceeded our expectations of service.  We had a choice of a continental or Manabi-traditional breakfast, and we all enjoyed the traditional option.  They even included juice upon our request.  Neighbor was safe enough to walk at night and we were able to eat a traditional "merrienda" (dinner) in a local outdoor tent, which was recommended to us at the hotel.  Air conditioning was a pleasant relief.  Hotel was quiet and perfect for getting a good night sleep before our business and tiring day of travel the next day.  Parking was off the street and out of view and very convenient and safe.  We received a call upon our departure that I had left my purse hanging over the back of one of the chairs at breakfast.  We asked if they could hold on to it for 30+ hours until we returned to Manta for our flight back to Quito.  They were glad to do that for us and had it ready as soon as we pulled in the next night on our way to the airport.   A convenient place to stay if looking for something close to airport for a good night sleep and personalized service.

reviews.title: Not a good choice.
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 20 de julio de 2024
reviews.negative_feedback: Our room wasn't cleaned regularly.  This is an issue in a country where used toilet paper has to be put in a trash can, not thrown in the toilet.  Then when we asked for clean towels, we had to wait a whole day for fresh towels - there weren't any spares.  There was only lukewarm water, although we waited for hot water for about 20 minutes, as is necessary in some places.  Also, there was a narrow window opposite the shower in the bathroom facing the hospital that had no covering on it.  The bathroom was absolutely claustrophobic.  And lastly, although Booking says they take credit cards, they don't.
reviews.positive_feedback: We arrived after a long day of travel and were given cold bottles of water on check-in.  The hotel was quiet.  Also, we had access to cups of hot water and tea or instant coffee anytime.

reviews.title: Delightfully tranquil oasis near airport and bus station
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 8 de marzo de 2023
reviews.negative_feedback:
No option to have breakfast and no places nearby to do so. Really needed a taxi to go places to eat.
Not the fault of the hotel, but many taxi drivers had a problem getting to the place without my help showing them the way.
reviews.positive_feedback:
Spotlessly clean, large room with great quiet a/c in a tranquil building in a delightful, beautifully maintained tropical garden. Beds were firm and very comfortable and had good linens and a great shower with excellent pressure and lots of hot water. A small kitchen had a fridge and microwave and some dishes and cutlery. There's even a pool table in the garden!!!
Hosts were delightful and always happy to call a taxi for us. Conversation was limited by my poor Spanish, but all our needs were met cheerfully. Cold Club beer, available at the front desk for $2, was a welcome touch as we arrived quite late and didn't have time to go out.
Location is a mixed bag. You are very close to both the bus station and the airport, about the minimum $1.50 ride from either, and a beach is about a 20 minute walk away. The main beaches and downtown are a bit further away but still only a $3 taxi ride away. We were advised to take a cab at night, which we prefer to do anyway.
